item.title: Looks like KDE is finally usable
item.description: Looks like KDE is finally doing the right thing with their 5.18 Plasma desktop. First, it looks consistent for the first time in years. Then, its shell is written in something else than Javascript, and it looks like it doesn’t have the mad memory leaks GNOME’s Mutter is famous for. And then, it’s not bloated, and seems to do the right thing with multi-monitor configurations. Haven’t yet tried it under Wayland, but I expect it to perform there as well.
